threads.com:
***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

last_replies.com:
>>21305998
Depends on the criteria.
>setting
gen 1-2, viewed as a single continuation, not to mention that I view all the ps1 games as a single entry since I just cannot play one without marathoning all 2.5 of them
>gameplay
loose tie between gen 1, LR and FA, depending on what I'm in the mood for at the moment
>missions
loose tie again, this time between gen 1, AA, FA and V (I really enjoyed the longer mission format)
>environments
open air locations in general, gen 1 and 2 (mostly AA with how varied they were there), street missions in underground habitats (so gen 1-3), V with its well realized urban locales was pretty good too
>designs
gen 4 first and foremost, thanks to the Rayleonard twins you get to pilot, then nonplayable Rayleonard frames you can't even take a better at look during the gameplay, then Nexus and LR for the definitive rendition of the old gen frames (looking at you Vixen), then AA for that cool looking and well performing heavy rj leg part that only appeared in that one game, then a honorable mention to gen 5 for the grungy industrial aesthetic despite the end products being both less than memorable and all over the place given the forced shape mixing, thanks to the aesthetic being tied to defence type instead of manufacturer for some reason

Material Points, MP. You get them from duplicated loot box items.

Standard Pass.

Never use CAP for supply pod pulls, use the tickets instead, same drops.

Let's discuss the best TV series of UC Gundam.
>Should I skip ZZ?
No! ZZ is essential viewing. The First Neo Zeon War is as important as any other conflict in UC history. You miss out on essential character development(Haman & Kamille/Fa, Minerva Zabi), fantastic mecha designs, best OP/ED songs in UC, lots of great new characters (Elpeo Ple, Ple Two, Chara Soon, Roux Louka) including Judau who is one of the best protagonists in Gundam.
>But /m/ told me Moon Moon ruins the show
Absolutely not. Moon Moon is important canon wise now with Moon Gundam being a thing.
>I'm still not convinced
Haman, Kamille, Fa, Bright Noa and other favourites are still there. ZZ is still referenced in newer UC titles showing it's importance and longevity.

last_replies.com:
>>21296838
The TV version adds a couple of things from the manga that weren't adapted for the OVA series. These changes mostly concern the 5th OVA, with the differences being apparent in the last leg of Ep.10 and the beginning of Ep.11 of the TV series. Without going into spoiler territory, they are related to a certain redhead character's fate.
However, I would absolutely advice against watching the TV series over the original OVA. The TV cut massively screws up the pacing and makes some objectively terrible choices in regards to the music. Watch the OVA and then, if you're so inclined, watch the aforementioned episodes of the TV series.

>>21295645
>There were Star Wars EU novels and comics telling their own story for years before "The Empire Strikes Back" was released, so how were they bridging a gap?
The three Han Solo Adventures pulps by Brian Daley and a Novel, plus the marvel comics and eventually Newspaper strips.

Then the Three Lando pulps by L Neil Smith and the Radioplays (Adapted by Daley) of ANH and ESB shortly after ESB with marvel and the newspaper strips still running, and Daley's comic of Ord Mantell, so there's at least two and I think now 3-5 "That Bounty Hunter on Ord Mantell" stories.

Daley eventually did the final RotJ Raidoplay (Sadly without Mark Hamill or Billy Dee Williams{They didn't even get a black guy or someone trying to sound black, White as fuck Lando is funny to listen to), but Anthony Daniels were there for all three) It also came out in like 96 so it had tie ins to the broader EU that blossomed with the WEG games and Heir to the Empire in '92.

Mara's disguised identity shows up at the palace and Han mentions hearing that Lando almost got the Falcon destroyed at Coruscant (Shadows of the Empire) Honestly the Newspaper strips I think l may have come after ESB, but interestingly enough they actually had some accidental "Settup" for ESB in some of the earliest full issue marvel comics.

The falcon has to extend an air pressure and radiation/temperature protection shield to "Touch shields" with another ship so Han and a pirate can make a handoff with just jetpacks and air masks. Which explains the Mynock scene only needing breathmasks in ESB.

>>21303359
Nah, ClassicWho never really got anywhere in Japan. The earliest Japanese release of any of itwas actually a set of translations of 5 the Target novelisations around 1980
>Space-Time Battle! (David Whitaker's novelisation of The Daleks)
>The Auton Army's Attack! (Terrance Dicks' novelisation of Spearhead from Space)
>Terror! Underground Monster (Mac Hulke's novelisation of The Silurians)
>The Terrible Final Weapon! (Mac Hulke's novelisation of The Colony in Space)
>The Daleks' Counterattack! (Terrance Dicks' novelisation of Day of the Daleks)
As for TV, all that was ever broadcast from ClassicWho were the first 2 Tom Baker seasons, and even then they weren't aired until 1988. Japanese dubbed, with Tessho Genda as the Doctor and Fumi Hirano as Sarah-Jane (kino casting tbqh)

***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21285886
Tomino tends to show things about his characters and world through small moments and stories that don't contribute much to the overall plot. Unfortunately, these are the same things that are the first to be cut when you have to reduce the runtime and as a result while the trilogy tells the plot of 0079 well enough, it fails to fully depict the characters, arguably one of the most unique parts of Tomino's shows.
I still wouldn't call them bad, just lacking compared to the show in some ways. I think they are best either as a refresher or for giving someone a taste of what UC Gundam is like without having to start with a 43 episode show.
